scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder comprises letters, telegrams, a check to Henry P. McGrath for $1000 from R.B. Chew, and a protested bill of exchange from R.B. Chew. Most of the correspondence was written to Calvin Cogswell Morgan of Lexington, Kentucky. Letters from Morgan's business partner, H.P. McGrath discuss hemp sales in New York and Maryland. Letters from J.W. George discuss suits ordered from Brooks Brothers and ask to order 50 pounds of smoked sausage to be shipped to Chicago, Illinois. A telegram from R.W. Woolly in Frankfort, Kentucky, asks when Morgan's election is to begin (December 20, 1878).
